sub_topic: Calculation of heat capacity of a substance
message_1: What is the heat capacity of a 50 g sample of iron at 25°C, given that the specific heat capacity of iron is 0.45 J/g °C?
message_2:
To calculate the heat capacity of the 50 g sample of iron, you can use the formula:

Heat capacity (Q) = mass (m) × specific heat capacity (c)

Given the mass (m) of the iron sample is 50 g and the specific heat capacity (c) of iron is 0.45 J/g °C, you can plug these values into the formula:

Q = 50 g × 0.45 J/g °C

Q = 22.5 J/°C

The heat capacity of the 50 g sample of iron at 25°C is 22.5 J/°C.
